steps.title: Take cuttings in late spring and through summer.
steps.content: Take cuttings in late spring and through summer. The cuttings should be about 30 centimeter (11.8 in) / 12" in length. Always take cuttings from branches that are not flowering. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Place the cuttings out in the sunshine for a week.
steps.content: Place the cuttings out in the sunshine for a week. This will allow the cut end to dry out and form a callous. Make sure that the cuttings stay dry; keep them away from any possibility of rain. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Fill a pot with sandy soil or sand that has been moistened and well-drained.
steps.content: Fill a pot with sandy soil or sand that has been moistened and well-drained. Root the cuttings in the pot of sand. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Fertilise with a high-potassium fertiliser.
steps.content: Fertilise with a high-potassium fertiliser. Keep in a warm place to grow. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Keep well watered and well drained.
steps.content: Keep well watered and well drained. After a time, you should see some of the cuttings starting to strike. [6] X Research source
